marketNews.title: US Labor Data Exceeds Expectations, Strengthening Higher‑for‑Longer Narrative
marketNews.content: The U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics reported that non‑farm payroll employment increased by 256,000 in December 2024, compared with 212,000 in November 2024. This result far exceeded the consensus expectation of 160,000 and marked the strongest job growth since March 2024. The U.S. unemployment rate fell to 4.1% in December 2024, down from 4.2% in November 2024, better than the consensus forecast of 4.2%. In response to the strong labor data, market expectations for Federal Reserve rate cuts have receded. According to the CME FedWatch Tool, the probability of a 25‑basis‑point rate cut by June 2025 fell to 39% on Monday (13 January) from 44% the week before, while the probability of rates remaining unchanged rose to 51% from 29% the week before. U.S. equity markets reacted negatively on Friday (10 January): the S&P 500 fell 1.54%, the Nasdaq fell 1.57%, and the DJIA fell 1.63%. The U.S. dollar index (DXY) strengthened 0.43% to 109.65, and the 10‑year Treasury yield rose 7 basis points to 4.76%. The rupiah weakened 0.56% to IDR 16,275 per USD on Monday (13 January). The Indonesian composite index (IHSG) fell 1.02% to 7,017, and the 10‑year Indonesian government bond yield rose 10 basis points to 7.28%, the highest level since November 2022. Edi Susianto, Head of the Monetary Management and Securities Department at Bank Indonesia, told Bloomberg that the central bank continues to safeguard currency stability through interventions in the bond market, the spot market, and domestic non‑deliverable forwards. Key Takeaway: Investors can lock in higher bond yields, such as the PBS032 bond (maturing in 1.5 years) offering a 6.8% annual yield, and may consider buying quality stocks that are currently correcting, such as Bank Mandiri (BMRI) and Bank Central Asia (BBCA). The prospect of fewer U.S. rate cuts could limit the space for Bank Indonesia to cut rates further. Bloomberg consensus expects Bank Indonesia to keep the policy rate at 6% at the Board of Governors meeting on Wednesday (15 January), although the consensus still anticipates a cumulative 75‑basis‑point cut to the BI Rate by the end of 2025. This article was previously released in Stockbit Commentary on Monday (13 January) morning.

marketNews.title: Various Market and Policy Updates
marketNews.content: Brent crude for the March 2025 contract rose 1.78% to USD 81.2 per barrel on Monday (13 January) following the announcement of new U.S. sanctions on the Russian energy sector over the weekend. The United States said the sanctions would target more than 200 entities and individuals involved in Russia’s energy sector, including Gazprom Neft (ME: SIBN) and Surgutneftegas, as well as over 180 oil‑tanker vessels. The United Kingdom also announced sanctions on Gazprom Neft and Surgutneftegas. Plt. Director General of Oil and Gas, Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, Dadan Kusdiana said on Friday (10 January) that the government is studying the possibility of importing oil from Russia, a step that will be coordinated with relevant partners as Indonesia moves toward full BRICS membership. Moshe Rizal, Chairman of the Investment Committee of the National Oil and Gas Companies Association, estimated that such imports could save the state budget billions of dollars per year by using discounted Russian oil prices. Bisman Bakhtiar, Executive Director of the Center for Energy and Mining Law Studies, warned that importing Russian oil could affect Indonesia’s diplomatic relations with Western countries, especially the United States. Director General of Customs and Excise, Nirwala Dwi Heryanto, said on Friday (10 January) that the government plans to implement an excise tax on sweetened beverages (MBDK) in the second half of 2025 if the process proceeds smoothly. Technical regulations will first be prepared through a Government Regulation and a Ministry of Finance Regulation, covering thresholds, product types, and tax rates. Previously, in September 2024, the House of Representatives proposed a minimum MBDK tax of 2.5% for 2025, to be gradually increased to 20%. China reported import growth of 1% year‑on‑year to USD 230.79 billion in December 2024 (versus a November decline of 3.9% YoY), surpassing the consensus forecast of a 1.5% YoY decline and marking the highest level in 27 months. This was the first monthly import increase since September 2024 and the strongest growth since July 2024, driven by robust year‑end demand and expectations of tighter U.S. chip import restrictions. Cumulatively, China’s 2024 imports rose 1.1% YoY to USD 2.59 trillion. Gita Mahyarani, Acting Executive Director of the Indonesian Coal Mining Association, said on Friday (10 January) that national coal production in 2025 is expected to rise as domestic demand increases and Indonesia joins BRICS, which will strengthen coal exports to China and India. Indonesia produced 831 million tonnes of coal in 2024 (+7.8% YoY) with sales of 811.54 million tonnes (+8% YoY), both exceeding the 2024 government targets by 17% and 8% respectively. The Ministry of Energy targets coal production of 740 million tonnes in 2025. Faisol Reza, Deputy Minister of Industry, said on Friday (10 January) that the government will replace the electric‑motor subsidy program of IDR 7 million per unit with a VAT incentive (PPN DTP). No timeline was provided as the mechanism is still under discussion. Joko Raharjo, Corporate Secretary of PT PP, said the company will allocate 26 hectares of land in the Greater Jakarta area, West Java, Yogyakarta, and Pekanbaru to support the joint Indonesia‑Qatar program to build one million houses.

tickerNews.title: WIFI: Arsari Group Becomes Investor in WIFI
tickerNews.content: $WIFI: The Arsari Group entity, PT Arsari Sentra Data, announced the purchase of 45% of the shares in the controlling company Solusi Sinergi Digital, PT Investasi Sukses Bersama, from Tinawati with a transaction value not disclosed. After this transaction, PT Arsari Sentra Data indirectly holds 22.55% of WIFI shares. In a separate transaction, Arwin Rasyid and Fadel Muhammad each announced the purchase of 27.22% of the shares in the WIFI shareholder company, PT Media Wiguna Nusantara, from PT Sinergi Investasi Digital with a transaction value not disclosed. After this transaction, Arwin Rasyid and Fadel Muhammad each hold 7.5% of WIFI shares indirectly.

tickerNews.title: PTRO: Petrosea Clarifies Lack of Knowledge on Anchor Buyer in RATU IPO
tickerNews.content: $PTRO: Petrosea stated in a clarification to the IDX that the company does not know whether Prajogo Pangestu acted as an anchor buyer in the IPO of Raharja Energi Cepu ($RATU). PTRO also mentioned that it has no plan to expand its project portfolio by participating in the management of oil and gas blocks owned by RATU.

tickerNews.title: BRMS: Director Purchases Approximately 2.3 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: $BRMS: Bumi Resources Minerals director Herwin Wahyu Hidayat purchased approximately 2.3 million BRMS shares at an average price of 430 rupiah per share on 8 January 2025. The total transaction value was about 1 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Herwin Wahyu Hidayat’s ownership in BRMS increased from zero to 0.0016%.

tickerNews.title: INDY: Indika Energy Appoints Macmahon as Contractor for Awak Mas Gold Project
tickerNews.content: $INDY: Indika Energy, through its subsidiary PT Masmindo Dwi Area, announced that Macmahon Holdings Limited (ASX: MAH) has been appointed as the mining services contractor for the Awak Mas gold project in South Sulawesi, with a contract value of 463 million Australian dollars for a 7‑year term. The contract will start in mid‑2025 with an option to extend for 5 years.

tickerNews.title: PGAS: Additional Gas Supply and LNG Cooperation Announced
tickerNews.content: $PGAS: Perusahaan Gas Negara announced an additional gas supply of 4,651 BBtu from the Jabung Block owned by PetroChina International Jabung Ltd., under a gas sales agreement effective from 1 January 2025 to 31 December 2026. The additional supply is intended to meet industrial and power customers’ needs as allocated by the government. In a separate transaction, PGAS also announced a cooperation with the West Papua State‑owned Enterprise to utilize LNG allocation from PT Padoma Lirik Energy, with a volume of approximately 20 MMSCFD, equivalent to two cargoes per year.

tickerNews.title: AKRA: Share Purchases by Controlling Shareholder and Director
tickerNews.content: $AKRA: PT Arthakencana Rayatama, the controlling shareholder of AKR Corporindo, purchased 1.5 million AKRA shares at an average price of 1,065.4 rupiah per share between 7–9 January 2025. The total transaction value was about 1.6 billion rupiah. After this transaction, PT Arthakencana Rayatama’s ownership increased from 63.611% to 63.619%. In a separate transaction, AKRA director Nery Polim purchased 630,000 AKRA shares at an average price of 1,045 rupiah per share on 7 January 2025, totaling about 658 million rupiah. After this transaction, Nery Polim’s ownership rose from 0.005% to 0.008%.

tickerNews.title: HRTA: Strategic Cooperation with PT Pegadaian to Support Gold Ecosystem
tickerNews.content: $HRTA: Hartadinata Abadi announced a strategic cooperation with PT Pegadaian aimed at supporting the development of Indonesia’s gold ecosystem and increasing public literacy on gold investment. Through this cooperation, HRTA’s Emasku product will supply bullion to PT Pegadaian, thereby supporting the growth of bullion purchases in Indonesia.

tickerNews.title: EXCL: Proposed Board of Directors for XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera
tickerNews.content: $EXCL: Katadata reported that Axiata Group Berhad and Sinar Mas have announced a proposed board of directors for XLSmart Telecom Sejahtera, the merged entity of XL Axiata and Smartfren Telecom ($FREN). In the proposal, Rajeev Sethi is nominated as President Director of EXCL. Sethi currently serves as CEO of Robi Axiata, Axiata’s subsidiary in Bangladesh. Additionally, EXCL’s Chief Financial Officer, Antony Susilo, confirmed to Kontan that he will serve as EXCL’s CFO. The new board composition is expected to be submitted to the shareholders’ meeting in March or April 2025.
